text: These are the words which Moses spoke unto all Israel on this side of the Jordan in the wilderness, in the plain over against the Red Sea, between Paran, Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
speaker: Narrator

text: (There are eleven days’ journey from Horeb by the way of Mount Seir unto Kadeshbarnea.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, that Moses spoke unto the sons of Israel, according unto all that the LORD had commanded him regarding them;
speaker: Narrator

text: after he had slain Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, and Og, the king of Bashan, who dwelt at Astaroth in Edrei;
speaker: Narrator

text: on this side of the Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses resolved to declare this law, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD our God spoke unto us in Horeb, saying, Ye have dwelt long enough in this mount;
speaker: Narrator

text: turn and take your journey and go to the mount of the Amorite and unto all the places nearby, in the plain, in the hills, and in the valleys and to the Negev and by the sea side to the land of the Canaanite and unto Lebanon unto the great river, the river Euphrates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have given the land in your presence; go in and possess the land which the LORD swore unto your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, that he would give unto them and to their seed after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I spoke unto you at that time, saying, I am not able to bear you myself alone;
speaker: Narrator

text: the LORD your God has multiplied you, and, behold, ye are this day as the stars of heaven for multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the LORD God of your fathers add upon you a thousand times so many more as ye are and bless you, as he has promised!
speaker: Narrator

text: How can I myself alone bear your troubles and your burdens and your strife?
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me from among you, of your tribes, wise and understanding and expert men, and I will make them the head over you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye answered me and said, The thing which thou hast spoken is good for us to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I took the principals of your tribes, wise men and experts, and made them princes over you, princes over thousands and princes over hundreds and princes over fifties and princes over tens and officers among your tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I charged your judges at that time, saying, Hear the causes between your brethren and judge righteously between every man and his brother and the stranger that is with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not respect persons in judgment, but ye shall hear the small as well as the great; ye shall not be afraid of the face of man, for the judgment is God’s; and the cause that is too hard for you, bring it unto me, and I will hear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I commanded you at that time all the things which ye should do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when we departed from Horeb, we went through all that great and terrible wilderness, which ye saw by the way of the mountain of the Amorite, as the LORD our God commanded us; and we came to Kadeshbarnea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said unto you, Ye are come unto the mountain of the Amorite, which the LORD our God gives unto us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the LORD thy God has given the land before thee; go up and possess it, as the LORD God of thy fathers has said unto thee; fear not, neither be discouraged.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye came near unto me every one of you and said, We will send men before us, and they shall spy us out the land and bring us word again by what way we must go up and into what cities we shall come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the saying seemed good unto me, and I took twelve men of you, one of each tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they turned and went up into the mountain and came unto the valley of Eshcol and spied out the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took of the fruit of the land in their hands and brought it down unto us and brought us word again and said, It is a good land which the LORD our God gives us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding ye would not go up, but rebelled against the commandment of the LORD your God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye murmured in your tents and said, Because the LORD hated us, he has brought us forth out of the land of Egypt to deliver us into the hand of the Amorite, to destroy us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where shall we go up? Our brethren have discouraged our heart, saying, This people is greater and taller than we; the cities are great and walled up to heaven; and moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakims there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said unto you, Dread not, neither be afraid of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD your God who goes before you, he shall fight for you, according to all that he did with you in Egypt before your eyes;
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the wilderness thou hast seen how that the LORD thy God bore thee, as a man doth bear his son, in all the way that ye went until ye came into this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet with all this ye did not believe in the LORD your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who went in the way before you to search you out a place to pitch your tents, with fire by night, to show you by what way ye should go, and with a cloud by day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD heard the voice of your words and was angry and swore, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely not one of these men of this evil generation shall see that good land, which I swore to give unto your fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him will I give the land that he has trodden upon, and to his sons, because he has perfectly followed the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the LORD was angry with me for your sakes, saying, Thou shalt not go in there either.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Joshua, the son of Nun, who stands before thee, he shall go in there; encourage him; for he shall cause Israel to inherit it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover your little ones, whom ye said should be a prey and your children who in that day had no knowledge between good and evil, they shall go in there, and unto them will I give it, and they shall inherit it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, return and take your journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then ye answered and said unto me, We have sinned against the LORD, we will go up and fight, according to all that the LORD our God has commanded us. And when ye had girded on every man his weapons of war, ye were ready to go up into the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto me, Say unto them, Do not go up or fight, for I am not among you, lest ye be smitten before your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I spoke unto you, and ye would not hear but were rebels against the word of the LORD, and went presumptuously up into the hill.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Amorite, who dwelt in that mountain, came out against you and chased you, as bees do, and destroyed you in Seir, even unto Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye returned and wept before the LORD, but the LORD would not hearken to your voice, nor give ear unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So ye abode in Kadesh many days, according unto the days that ye abode there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we turned and took our journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea, as the LORD had said unto me; and we went around Mount Seir many days
speaker: Narrator

text: until the LORD spoke unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have gone around this mountain long enough; return unto the Aquilon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And command thou the people, saying, Ye are to pass through the border of your brethren, the sons of Esau, who dwell in Seir; and they shall be afraid of you; take care unto yourselves, therefore;
speaker: Narrator

text: do not seek a fight with them; for I will not give you of their land, no, not so much as a foot breadth because I have given Mount Seir unto Esau for an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall buy food from them for money that ye may eat, and ye shall also buy water from them for money that ye may drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD thy God has blessed thee in all the works of thy hand; he knows thy walking through this great wilderness; these forty years the LORD thy God has been with thee; thou hast lacked nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when we passed by our brethren, the sons of Esau, who dwelt in Seir, through the way of the plain from Elath and from Eziongaber, we turned and passed by the way of the wilderness of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto me, Distress not the Moabites, neither contend with them in battle; for I will not give thee of their land for a possession because I have given Ar unto the sons of Lot for an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: (The Emims dwelt therein in times past, a people great, and many and tall as the Anakims,
speaker: Narrator

text: which also were accounted giants as the Anakims; but the Moabites call them Emims.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Horims also dwelt in Seir before time, but the sons of Esau inherited from them, and they destroyed them from before them and dwelt in their stead as Israel did in the land of his possession, which the LORD gave unto them.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Now rise up, said I, and pass the brook Zered. And we went over the brook Zered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the days in which we came from Kadeshbarnea until we were come over the brook Zered, was thirty-eight years until all the generation of the men of war were wasted out from among the camp, as the LORD swore unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For indeed the hand of the LORD was against them, to destroy them from among the camp until they were consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people
speaker: Narrator

text: that the LORD spoke unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art to pass the border of Moab today unto Ar,
speaker: Narrator

text: and when thou comest near over against the sons of Ammon, do not distress them nor meddle with them, for I will not give thee of the land of the sons of Ammon any possession because I have given it unto the sons of Lot for an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: (That also was accounted a land of giants; giants dwelt therein in another time, and the Ammonites called them Zamzummims,
speaker: Narrator

text: a people great and many and tall as the Anakims; whom the LORD destroyed before the Ammonites; and they inherited from them and dwelt in their stead,
speaker: Narrator

text: as he did to the sons of Esau who dwelt in Seir when he destroyed the Horims from before them; and they inherited from them and dwelt in their stead even unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Avims who dwelt in Hazerim, even unto Gaza, the Caphtorims, who came forth out of Caphtor, destroyed them and dwelt in their stead.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise ye up, take your journey, and pass the river Arnon; behold, I have given into thine hand Sihon, the Amorite king of Heshbon, and his land; begin, take possession and contend with him in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: This day I will begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of thee upon the peoples that are under the whole heaven, who shall hear the report of thee, and shall tremble and be in anguish because of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I sent ambassadors out of the wilderness of Kedemoth unto Sihon, king of Heshbon, with words of peace, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me pass through thy land; I will go along by the high way; I will neither turn unto the right hand nor to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt sell me food for money, that I may eat, and give me water for money, that I may drink; I will only pass through on my feet
speaker: Narrator

text: (as the sons of Esau, who dwell in Seir, and the Moabites, who dwell in Ar, did unto me) until I shall pass the Jordan into the land which the LORD our God gives us.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Sihon, king of Heshbon, would not let us pass by him, for the LORD thy God had hardened his spirit and made his heart obstinate that he might deliver him into thy hand as until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto me, Behold, I have begun to give Sihon and his land before thee; begin, take possession that thou may inherit his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD our God delivered him before us; and we smote him and his sons and all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we took all his cities at that time and utterly destroyed all the cities, the men and the women and the little ones; we left none to remain.
speaker: Narrator

text: We took only the beasts for a prey unto ourselves and the spoil of the cities which we took.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Aroer, which is by the brink of the river of Arnon, and from the city that is by the river even unto Gilead, there was not one city escaped us; the LORD our God delivered all of them before us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only unto the land of the sons of Ammon thou camest not, nor unto any place of the river Jabbok, nor unto the cities in the mountains, nor unto any place that the LORD our God forbade us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we turned, and went up the way to Bashan; and Og the king of Bashan, came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto me, Fear him not, for I have delivered him and all his people and his land into thy hand, and thou shalt do unto him as thou didst unto Sihon, king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the LORD our God delivered into our hand Og also, the king of Bashan, and all his people, and we smote him until none was left to him remaining.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we took all his cities at that time there was not a city which we did not take from them, sixty cities, all the region of Argob, of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these cities were fenced with high walls, gates, and bars besides a great many unwalled towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we utterly destroyed them, as we did unto Sihon, king of Heshbon, utterly destroying every city, men, women, and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the beasts and the spoil of the cities, we took for a prey to ourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we also took at that time out of the hand of the two kings of the Amorites the land that was on this side of the Jordan, from the river of Arnon unto Mount Hermon
speaker: Narrator

text: (which Hermon the Sidonians call Sirion and the Amorites call it Shenir) and
speaker: Narrator

text: all the cities of the plain and all Gilead and all Bashan unto Salchah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: For only Og, king of Bashan, had remained of the remnant of giants; behold, his bedstead was a bedstead of iron; is it not in Rabbath of the sons of Ammon? Nine cubits was the length thereof and four cubits the breadth of it, after the cubit of a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this land, which we inherited at that time, from Aroer, which is by the river Arnon, and half of Mount Gilead and the cities thereof, I gave unto the Reubenites and to the Gadites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rest of Gilead and all Bashan (fertile ground), being the kingdom of Og, gave I unto the half tribe of Manasseh: all the region of Argob, with all Bashan, which was called the land of giants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jair, the son of Manasseh, took all the country of Argob unto the border of Geshuri and Maachathi and called them after his own name, Bashanhavothjair, unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I gave Gilead unto Machir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto the Reubenites and unto the Gadites I gave from Gilead even unto the river Arnon, half the valley for a border even unto the river Jabbok, which is the border of the sons of Ammon,
speaker: Narrator

text: the plain also and the Jordan and the border thereof from Chinnereth even unto the sea of the plain, even the salt sea, under Ashdothpisgah eastward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I commanded you at that time, saying, The LORD your God has given you this land to possess it; ye shall pass armed before your brethren, the sons of Israel, all that are valiant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only your wives and your little ones and your livestock (for I know that ye have much livestock) shall abide in your cities which I have given you
speaker: Narrator

text: until the LORD has given rest unto your brethren, as well as unto you, and until they also inherit the land which the LORD your God has given them beyond the Jordan; then shall ye return each man unto his possession, which I have given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I also commanded Joshua at that time, saying, Thine eyes have seen all that the LORD your God has done unto these two kings, so shall the LORD do unto all the kingdoms where thou passest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not fear them, for the LORD your God, he shall fight for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I besought the LORD at that time, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord GOD, thou hast begun to show thy slave thy greatness and thy mighty hand; for what God is there in heaven or in earth that can do according to thy works and according to thy mighty acts?
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray thee, let me go over and see that good land that is beyond the Jordan, that goodly mountain and Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD was angry with me for your sakes and would not hear me, and the LORD said unto me, Let it suffice thee; speak no more unto me of this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Climb up into the top of Pisgah and lift up thine eyes westward and towards the Aquilon and towards the Negev and eastward and behold it with thine eyes, for thou shalt not go over this Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: But charge Joshua and encourage him and comfort him, for he shall go over before this people, and he shall cause them to inherit the land which thou shalt see.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we abode in the valley over against Bethpeor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, therefore, hear, O Israel, the statutes and the rights which I teach you, for in doing them ye shall live and go in and inherit the land which the LORD God of your fathers gives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall ye diminish anything from it, that ye may keep the commandments of the LORD your God which I command you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your eyes have seen what the LORD did because of Baalpeor; for all the men that followed Baalpeor, the LORD thy God has destroyed them from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye that did cleave unto the LORD your God are alive, every one of you this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have taught you statutes and rights, even as the LORD my God commanded me, that ye should do thus in the midst of the land where ye are about to enter in to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep them, therefore, and do them, for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples, who shall hear all these statutes and say, Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what nation is there so great who has God so nigh unto them, as the LORD our God is in all things that we call upon him for?
speaker: Narrator

text: And what nation is there so great that has statutes and rights so just as all this law, which I set before you this day?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, take heed to thyself and keep thy soul diligently lest thou forget the things which thine eyes have seen and lest they depart from thy heart all the days of thy life, but teach them to thy sons and thy sons’ sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: The day that thou didst stand before the LORD thy God in Horeb, when the LORD said unto me, Gather the people together unto me, and I will make them hear my words that they may learn to fear me all the days that they shall live upon the earth and that they may teach their sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye came near and stood under the mountain, and the mountain burned with fire unto the midst of the heavens, with darkness, clouds, and thick darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto you out of the midst of the fire; ye heard the voice of the words, but saw no likeness; only ye heard a voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he declared unto you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, the ten words; and he wrote them upon two tables of stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD commanded me at that time to teach you the statutes and rights that ye might do them in the land which ye are about to enter to possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: Diligently guard, therefore, your souls, for ye saw no manner of likeness on the day that the LORD spoke unto you in Horeb out of the midst of the fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest ye corrupt yourselves and make yourselves a graven image, the similitude of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
speaker: Narrator

text: the likeness of any beast that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged fowl that flies in the air,
speaker: Narrator

text: the likeness of any animal that moves on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the waters beneath the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And lest thou lift up thine eyes unto heaven, and when thou seest the sun and the moon and the stars, even all the host of heaven, and should be driven to worship them and serve them because the LORD thy God has conceded them unto all the peoples under all the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD has taken you and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, even out of Egypt, to be unto him the people of his inheritance, as ye are this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, the LORD was angry with me for your sakes and swore that I should not go over Jordan and that I should not go in unto that good land, which the LORD thy God gives thee for an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I must die in this land and will not pass the Jordan, but ye shall pass and inherit that good land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep yourselves, do not forget the covenant of the LORD your God, which he established with you, and make yourselves a graven image or the likeness of any thing, which the LORD thy God has forbidden thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD thy God is a consuming fire, even a jealous God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt beget children and grandchildren and ye shall have remained long in the land and shall corrupt yourselves and make a graven image or the likeness of any thing and shall do evil in the sight of the LORD thy God, to provoke him to anger,
speaker: Narrator

text: I put heaven and earth as witnesses today that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land unto which ye pass the Jordan to inherit it; ye shall not prolong your days upon it without being utterly destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD shall scatter you among the peoples, and ye shall be left few in number among the Gentiles, unto whom the LORD shall take you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there ye shall serve gods, the work of men’s hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if from there, thou shalt seek the LORD thy God, thou shalt find him if thou seek him with all thy heart and with all thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou art in trouble and all these things are come upon thee, if in the latter days thou shalt turn to the LORD thy God and shalt hear his voice
speaker: Narrator

text: (for the LORD thy God is a merciful God), he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he swore unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask, therefore, now of the days that are past, which were before thee, since the day that God created man upon the earth and ask from the one side of heaven unto the other whether there has been any such thing as this great thing is, or has any other been heard like it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have a people ever heard the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as thou hast heard, and lived?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or has God assayed to go and take him a nation from the midst of another nation, by trials, by signs and by wonders and by war and by a mighty hand and by a stretched out arm and by great terrors, according to all that the LORD your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto thee it was shown that thou mightest know that the LORD he is God; there is no one else other than he.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the heavens he made thee to hear his voice that he might instruct thee, and upon earth he showed thee his great fire, and thou hast heard his words out of the midst of the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because he loved thy fathers, therefore, he chose their seed after them and brought thee out in his sight with his mighty power out of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: to drive out Gentiles from before thee greater and mightier than thou art, to bring thee in, to give thee their land for an inheritance, as it is this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know therefore this day and consider it in thine heart that the LORD is the only God in heaven above and upon the earth beneath; there is no other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt keep, therefore, his statutes and his commandments which I command thee this day that it may go well with thee and with thy sons after thee and that thou may prolong thy days upon the land which the LORD thy God gives thee, for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses separated three cities on this side of the Jordan toward the sunrising
speaker: Narrator

text: that the manslayer might flee there, who should kill his neighbour unawares and hated him not in times past and that fleeing unto one of these cities he might live:
speaker: Narrator

text: Namely, Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, of the Reubenites, and Ramoth in Gilead, of the Gadites, and Golan in Bashan, of the Manassites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the law which Moses set before the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the testimonies and the statutes and the rights, which Moses spoke unto the sons of Israel after they came forth out of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: on this side of the Jordan, in the valley over against Bethpeor, in the land of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon, whom Moses and the sons of Israel smote after they were come forth out of Egypt;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they possessed his land and the land of Og, king of Bashan, two kings of the Amorites, who were on this side of the Jordan toward the sunrising.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Aroer, which is by the bank of the river Arnon, even unto Mount Sion, which is Hermon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the plain on this side of the Jordan eastward, even unto the sea of the plain, under the springs of Pisgah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses called all Israel and said unto them, Hear, O Israel, the statutes and rights which I speak in your ears this day, that ye may learn them and keep them, to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not with our fathers did the LORD make this covenant, but with us, all of us who are here alive this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD spoke with you face to face in the mount out of the midst of the fire
speaker: Narrator

text: (I stood between the LORD and you at that time, to show you the word of the LORD, for ye were afraid by reason of the fire and did not climb the mount), saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: I AM thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt from the house of slavery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt have no other gods before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not make thee any graven image or any likeness of any thing that is in the heavens above or that is in the earth beneath or that is in the waters beneath the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not bow down to them nor serve them, for I the LORD thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the sons unto the third and fourth generation of those that hate me
speaker: Narrator

text: and showing mercy unto thousands, to those that love me and keep my commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not take the name of the LORD thy God in vain, for the LORD will not hold him innocent that takes his name in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep the sabbath day to sanctify it, as the LORD thy God has commanded thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days thou shalt labour and do all thy work,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the seventh day is the sabbath unto the LORD thy God; in it thou shalt not do any work, thou nor thy son nor thy daughter nor thy manslave nor thy maidslave nor thine ox nor thine ass nor any animal of thine nor thy stranger that is within thy gates, that thy manslave and thy maidslave may rest as well as thou.
speaker: Narrator

text: And remember that thou wast a slave in the land of Egypt and that the LORD thy God brought thee out of there with a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm; therefore, the LORD thy God has commanded thee to keep the sabbath day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honour thy father and thy mother, as the LORD thy God has commanded thee; that thy days may be prolonged and that it may go well with thee, in the land which the LORD thy God gives thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not murder.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not commit adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not steal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not give false testimony against thy neighbour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not desire thy neighbour’s wife, neither shalt thou covet thy neighbour’s house, his field or his manslave or his maidslave, his ox or his ass or any thing that is thy neighbour’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: These words the LORD spoke unto all your congregation in the mount out of the midst of the fire, of the cloud, and of the thick darkness, with a great voice, and he added no more. And he wrote them in two tables of stone and delivered them unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when ye heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness and saw the mountain that burned with fire that ye came near unto me, even all the princes of your tribes and your elders;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye said, Behold, the LORD our God has shown us his glory and his greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the midst of the fire; we have seen this day that God does talk with man, and he lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, therefore, why should we die? For this great fire will consume us; if we hear the voice of the LORD our God any more, then we shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what is all flesh that it should hear the voice of the living God that speaks out of the midst of the fire, as we heard, and live?
speaker: Narrator

text: Go thou near and hear all that the LORD our God shall say, and thou shalt tell us all that the LORD our God shall speak unto thee; and we will hear it, and do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD heard the voice of your words when ye spoke unto me, and the LORD said unto me, I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they have spoken unto thee; they have well said all that they have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: O that there were such a heart in them that they would fear me and keep all my commandments always that it might be well with them and with their children for ever!
speaker: Narrator

text: Go say to them, Return to your tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for thee, stand thou here by me, and I will speak unto thee all the commandments and the statutes and the rights, which thou shalt teach them, that they may do them in the land which I give them to inherit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall observe to do, therefore, as the LORD your God has commanded you; ye shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall walk in all the ways which the LORD your God has commanded you that ye may live and that it may be well with you and that ye may prolong your days in the land which ye are to inherit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the commandments, the statutes, and the rights, which the LORD your God commanded to teach you that ye might do them in the land into which ye go to inherit it
speaker: Narrator

text: that thou might fear the LORD thy God, to keep all his statutes and his commandments, which I command thee, thou and thy son and thy son’s son, all the days of thy life and that thy days may be prolonged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, therefore, O Israel, and observe to do it that it may be well with thee and that ye may be multiplied exceedingly (as the LORD God of thy fathers has said unto thee) in the land that flows with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God is one LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt love the LORD thy God with all thine heart and with all thy soul and with all thy might.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these words, which I command thee this day, shall be upon thy heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt repeat them diligently unto thy sons and shalt talk of them being in thy house and walking by the way, lying down in bed, and rising up;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thy hand, and they shall be as frontlets between thy eyes;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt write them upon the posts of thy house and on thy gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be, when the LORD thy God shall have brought thee into the land which he swore unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give it unto thee: great and goodly cities, which thou didst not build,
speaker: Narrator

text: and houses full of all good things, which thou didst not fill, and hewn out wells, which thou didst not dig, vineyards and olive trees, which thou didst not plant; when thou shalt have eaten and be full,
speaker: Narrator

text: then beware lest thou forget the LORD, who brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt fear the LORD thy God and serve him and shalt swear by his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not go after other gods, of the gods of the peoples who are round about you
speaker: Narrator

text: (for the LORD thy God is a jealous God among you) lest peradventure the anger of the LORD thy God be kindled against thee and destroy thee from off the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not tempt the LORD your God, as ye tempted him in Massah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall diligently keep the commandments of the LORD your God and his testimonies and his statutes, which he has commanded thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt do that which is right and good in the sight of the LORD that it may be well with thee and that thou may enter in and inherit the good land which the LORD swore unto thy fathers
speaker: Narrator

text: so that he will cast out all thine enemies from before thy presence, as the LORD has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when tomorrow thy son asks thee, saying, What are the testimonies and the statutes and the rights, which the LORD our God has commanded you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt say unto thy son, We were Pharaoh’s slaves in Egypt, and the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the LORD showed signs and wonders, great and sore, in Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his household, before our eyes;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he brought us out from there that he might bring us in, to give us the land which he swore unto our fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD commanded us to do all these statutes that we might fear the LORD our God for our good always that he might give us life, as it is at this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we shall have justice when we keep ourselves by doing all these commandments before the LORD our God, as he has commanded us.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the LORD thy God shall bring thee into the land into which thou must enter to inherit it and has cast out many Gentiles before thee, the Hittite and the Girgashite and the Amorite and the Canaanite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite, seven nations greater and mightier than thou;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when the LORD thy God shall deliver them before thee, thou shalt smite them and utterly destroy them; thou shalt make no covenant with them nor show mercy unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shalt thou make marriages with them; thy daughter thou shalt not give unto his son, nor his daughter shalt thou take unto thy son.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they will turn away thy son from following me that they may serve other gods; and the anger of the LORD will be kindled upon you and destroy thee suddenly.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thus shall ye deal with them: ye shall destroy their altars and break down their images and cut down their groves and burn their graven images in the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art a holy people unto the LORD thy God; the LORD thy God has chosen thee to be a special people unto himself, different from all the peoples that are upon the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not because ye were more than the other peoples has the LORD desired you and chosen you; for ye were the fewest of all the peoples;
speaker: Narrator

text: but because the LORD loved you and because he would keep the oath which he had sworn unto your fathers, has the LORD brought you out with a mighty hand and ransomed you out of the house of slavery from the hand of Pharaoh, king of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know, therefore, that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, who keeps covenant and mercy with those that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations
speaker: Narrator

text: and repays him that hates him to his face, to destroy him; he will not be slack to him that hates him; he will repay him to his face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep, therefore, the commandments and statutes and rights, which I command thee this day, to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, for having heard these rights and for having kept them by doing them that the LORD thy God shall keep the covenant with thee and the mercy which he swore unto thy fathers;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he will love thee and bless thee and multiply thee; he will also bless the fruit of thy womb and the fruit of thy land, thy grain and thy wine and thine oil, the increase of thy cows and the flocks of thy sheep, in the land which he swore unto thy fathers to give thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt be blessed above all peoples; there shall not be male or female barren among you or among your beasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD will take away from thee all sickness and will put none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which thou knowest, upon thee, but will lay them upon all those that hate thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt consume all the peoples which the LORD thy God shall deliver thee; thine eye shall have no pity upon them; neither shalt thou serve their gods; for that will be a snare unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt say in thy heart, These Gentiles are more than I; how can I dispossess them?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be afraid of them; remember well what the LORD thy God did with Pharaoh and with all Egypt;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the great trials which thine eyes saw and the signs and the wonders and the mighty hand and the outstretched arm, by which the LORD thy God brought thee out; so shall the LORD thy God do unto all the peoples of whose presence thou art afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the LORD thy God will send the hornet among them until those that are left and hide themselves from thee are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not faint before them; for the LORD thy God is among you, a great and terrible God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD thy God will put out those Gentiles before thee little by little; thou may not consume them at once lest the beasts of the field increase upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the LORD thy God shall deliver them before thee and shall destroy them with a mighty destruction until they are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall deliver their kings into thy hand, and thou shalt destroy their name from under heaven; no one shall be able to stand before thee until thou hast destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The graven images of their gods ye shall burn in the fire; thou shalt not desire the silver or gold that is on them nor take it unto thee lest thou be snared therein; for it is an abomination to the LORD thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shalt thou bring an abomination into thine house lest thou become an anathema like it, but thou shalt utterly detest it, and thou shalt utterly abhor it; for it is anathema.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take care to do all the commandments which I command thee this day that ye may live and be multiplied and enter in and inherit the land which the LORD swore unto your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt remember all the way by which the LORD thy God led thee these forty years in the wilderness to afflict thee and to prove thee to know what was in thine heart, whether thou would keep his commandments, or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he afflicted thee and caused thee to hunger and sustained thee with manna, food of which thou knewest not, neither did thy fathers know, that he might make thee know that man does not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of the LORD shall man live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy raiment never waxed old upon thee, neither did thy foot swell, these forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And know in thine heart, that as a man chastens his son, so the LORD thy God chastens thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep, therefore, the commandments of the LORD thy God by walking in his ways and fearing him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD thy God brings thee into a good land, a land of brooks, of waters, of fountains and depths that spring out of valleys and hills,
speaker: Narrator

text: a land of wheat and barley and vines and fig trees and pomegranates, a land of olives, of oil, and honey;
speaker: Narrator

text: a land in which thou shalt eat bread without scarceness; thou shalt not lack any thing in it, a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose mountains thou may dig brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt eat and be full and bless the LORD thy God for the good land which he has given thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thyself, that thou forget not the LORD thy God, to not fulfill his commandments and his rights and his statutes, which I command thee this day,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest peradventure when thou hast eaten and art full and hast built goodly houses and dwelt therein,
speaker: Narrator

text: and when thy herds and thy flocks multiply and thy silver and thy gold is multiplied and all that thou hast is multiplied,
speaker: Narrator

text: then thine heart be lifted up, and thou forget the LORD thy God, who brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery,
speaker: Narrator

text: who led thee through that great and terrible wilderness of burning serpents and scorpions and drought, where there was no water, who brought thee forth water out of the rock of flint,
speaker: Narrator

text: who fed thee in the wilderness with manna, a food which thy fathers knew not, afflicting thee and proving thee, to do thee good at thy latter end;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou say in thy heart, My power and the might of my hand has gotten me this wealth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt remember the LORD thy God, for it is he that gives thee the power to get wealth that he may confirm his covenant which he swore unto thy fathers, as it is this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be, if thou do at all forget the LORD thy God and walk after other gods and serve them and worship them, I protest against you this day that ye shall surely perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Gentiles which the LORD shall destroy before your face, so shall ye perish because ye would not attend to the voice of the LORD your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Israel: Thou art ready to pass over the Jordan this day to enter in to inherit that of Gentiles greater and mightier than thyself, cities great and fenced up to heaven,
speaker: Narrator

text: A people, great and tall, sons of the Anakims, whom thou knowest and of whom thou hast heard say, Who can stand before the sons of Anak!
speaker: Narrator

text: Understand, therefore, this day that the LORD thy God is he who passes before thee; as a consuming fire he shall destroy them and humble them before thee, and thou shalt drive them out and destroy them quickly, as the LORD has said unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Think not in thine heart, after the LORD thy God has cast them out from before thee, saying, Because of my righteousness the LORD has brought me in to inherit this land; rather for the wickedness of these Gentiles the LORD drives them out from before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not for thy righteousness or for the uprightness of thine heart, dost thou enter in to inherit their land; but for the wickedness of these Gentiles, the LORD thy God drives them out from before thee and that he may confirm the word which the LORD swore unto thy fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Understand, therefore, that the LORD thy God does not give thee this good land to inherit because of thy righteousness, for thou art a stiffnecked people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, and forget not, how thou hast provoked the LORD thy God to wrath in the wilderness; from the day that thou didst depart out of the land of Egypt until ye came unto this place, ye have been rebellious against the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also in Horeb ye provoked the LORD to wrath, so that the LORD was angry with you to have destroyed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I climbed up into the mount to receive the tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant which the LORD made with you, then I abode in the mount forty days and forty nights, without eating bread or drinking water;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the LORD delivered unto me two tables of stone written with the finger of God, and on them was written according to all the words which the LORD spoke with you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass at the end of forty days and forty nights that the LORD gave me the two tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto me, Arise, go down quickly from here, for thy people which thou hast brought forth out of Egypt have corrupted themselves; they are quickly turned aside out of the way which I commanded them; they have made themselves a molten image.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, the LORD spoke unto me, saying, I have seen this people, and, behold, it is a stiffnecked people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me alone that I may destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven; and I will make of thee a nation mightier and greater than they.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I turned and came down from the mount with the two tables of the covenant in my two hands and the mount burned with fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: and I looked, and, behold, ye had sinned against the LORD your God and had made yourselves a molten calf; ye had turned aside quickly out of the way which the LORD had commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I took the two tables and cast them out of my two hands and broke them before your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I fell down before the LORD, as at the first, forty days and forty nights; I neither ate bread nor drank water because of all your sins in which ye sinned in doing wickedly in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure with which the LORD was wroth against you to destroy you. But the LORD hearkened unto me at that time also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD was very angry with Aaron to have destroyed him, and I prayed for Aaron also the same time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I took your sin, the calf which ye had made, and burnt it with fire and stamped it and ground it very small even until it was as small as dust, and I cast the dust thereof into the brook that descended out of the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also at Taberah and at Massah and at Kibrothhattaavah, ye provoked the LORD to wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise when the LORD sent you from Kadeshbarnea, saying, Go up and inherit the land which I have given you; then ye rebelled against the commandment of the LORD your God, and ye did not believe him nor hearken to his voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have been rebels against the LORD from the day that I knew you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus I fell down before the LORD forty days and forty nights, as I fell down at the first, because the LORD had said he would destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I prayed, therefore, unto the LORD and said, O Lord GOD, destroy not thy people and thine inheritance, which thou hast ransomed through thy greatness, which thou hast brought forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember thy slaves, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; look not unto the stubbornness of this people nor to their wickedness nor to their sin,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest those of the land from which thou didst bring us out say, Because the LORD was not able to bring them into the land which he promised them or because he hated them, he has brought them out to slay them in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they are thy people and thine inheritance, which thou didst bring out by thy mighty power and by thy outstretched arm.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time the LORD said unto me, Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first and come up unto me into the mount and make thee an ark of wood,
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will write on the tables the words that were in the first tables which thou didst brake, and thou shalt put them in the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I made an ark of cedar wood and hewed two tables of stone like unto the first, and went up into the mount, having the two tables in my hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he wrote on the tables, according to the first writing, the ten words which the LORD spoke unto you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly; and the LORD gave them unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I turned and came down from the mount and put the tables in the ark which I had made; and there they are, as the LORD commanded me.
speaker: Narrator

text: (After this, the sons of Israel took their journey from Beeroth of the sons of Jaakan to Mosera; there Aaron died, and there he was buried; and Eleazar, his son, received the priesthood in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they journeyed unto Gudgodah and from Gudgodah to Jotbath, a land of rivers of waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time the LORD separated the tribe of Levi to bear the ark of the covenant of the LORD, to stand before the LORD to minister unto him, and to bless in his name, unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, Levi had no part nor inheritance with his brethren; the LORD is his inheritance, according as the LORD thy God said unto him.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And I stayed in the mount, like the first time, forty days and forty nights; and the LORD hearkened unto me at that time also, and the LORD did not desire to destroy thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto me, Arise, take thy journey before the people that they may enter in and inherit the land, which I swore unto their fathers to give unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, Israel, what does the LORD thy God require of thee, but to fear the LORD thy God, to walk in all his ways and to love him and to serve the LORD thy God with all thy heart and with all thy soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: to keep the commandments of the LORD and his statutes, which I command thee this day for thy good?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the heavens and the heaven of heavens are of the LORD thy God, the earth also, with all that is therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD delighted only in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you from among all the peoples, as it is this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Circumcise, therefore, the foreskin of your heart, and no longer be stiffnecked.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, a great God, mighty, and terrible, who makes no exception of persons, nor takes a bribe;
speaker: Narrator

text: he executes the rights of the fatherless and the widow and also loves the stranger, giving him food and clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall love, therefore, the stranger, for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt fear the LORD thy God; him shalt thou serve, and to him shalt thou cleave and swear by his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall be thy praise, and he shall be thy God, that has done with thee these great and terrible things, which thine eyes have seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy fathers went down into Egypt with seventy souls, and now the LORD thy God has made thee as the stars of heaven in multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, thou shalt love the LORD thy God and keep his charge and his statutes and his rights and his commandments, always.
speaker: Narrator

text: And know ye this day; for I speak not with your children who have not known and who have not seen the chastisement of the LORD your God, his greatness, his mighty hand, and his outstretched arm,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his miracles and his acts, which he did in the midst of Egypt unto Pharaoh, the king of Egypt and unto all his land,
speaker: Narrator

text: and what he did unto the army of Egypt, unto their horses and to their chariots, how he made the water of the Red Sea to overflow them as they pursued after you and how the LORD has destroyed them unto this day,
speaker: Narrator

text: and what he did with you in the wilderness until ye came into this place,
speaker: Narrator

text: and what he did unto Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben: how the earth opened her mouth and swallowed them up and their households and their tents and all the substance that was in their possession in the midst of all Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: but your eyes have seen all the great acts of the LORD which he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep, therefore, all the commandments which I command you this day that ye may be strong and enter in and inherit the land, into which ye go to inherit it
speaker: Narrator

text: and that ye may prolong your days in the land, which the LORD swore unto your fathers to give unto them and to their seed, a land that flows with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the land, into which thou goest to inherit it, is not as the land of Egypt, from which ye came out, where thou didst sow thy seed and water it with thy foot, as a garden of herbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The land, into which ye go to inherit it, is a land of mountains and valleys and drinks water of the rain of heaven,
speaker: Narrator

text: a land which the LORD thy God procures; the eyes of the LORD thy God are always upon it, from the beginning of the year even unto the end of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, if ye shall hearken diligently unto my commandments which I command you this day: to love the LORD your God and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul
speaker: Narrator

text: that I will give you the rain of your land in its due season, the early rain and the latter rain, and thou shalt gather in thy grain and thy wine and thine oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will send grass in thy fields for thy beasts, and thou shalt eat and be full.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep yourselves, therefore, that your heart not be deceived and ye turn aside and serve other gods and worship them;
speaker: Narrator

text: and then the LORD’s wrath be kindled against you and he shut up the heavens, that there be no rain and that the land yield not her fruit, and lest ye perish quickly from off the good land which the LORD gives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, ye shall lay up these my words in your heart and in your soul and bind them for a sign upon your hand that they may be as frontlets between your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall teach them to your children that ye may think of them sitting in thy house and walking by the way, lying down in bed, and rising up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt write them upon the door posts of thine house and upon thy gates
speaker: Narrator

text: that your days may be multiplied, and the days of your children, upon the land which the LORD swore unto your fathers to give them, as the days of the heavens upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if ye shall diligently keep all these commandments which I command you, to do them, loving the LORD your God and walking in all his ways, to cleave unto him,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the LORD will drive out all these Gentiles from before you, and ye shall possess nations greater and mightier than yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every place upon which the soles of your feet shall tread shall be yours, from the wilderness and Lebanon; from the river, the river Euphrates, even unto the western sea shall be your border.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one shall be able to stand before you; for the LORD your God shall lay the fear of you and the dread of you upon all the land that ye shall tread upon, as he has said unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I set before you this day the blessing and the curse:
speaker: Narrator

text: The blessing if ye hear the commandments of the LORD your God, which I command you this day,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the curse if ye will not hear the commandments of the LORD your God, but turn aside out of the way which I command you this day, to go after other gods, which ye have not known.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass when the LORD thy God has brought thee in unto the land where thou goest to inherit it that thou shalt put the blessing upon Mount Gerizim and the curse upon Mount Ebal,
speaker: Narrator

text: which are on the other side of the Jordan, by the way of the west, in the land of the Canaanite, who dwells in the plain over against Gilgal, beside the plains of Moreh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye shall pass the Jordan to go in to inherit the land which the LORD your God gives you, and ye shall possess it and dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep yourselves, therefore, to do all the statutes and rights which I set before you this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the statutes and rights which ye shall keep to do them in the land which the LORD God of thy fathers gives thee to inherit all the days that ye live upon the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall utterly destroy all the places, upon which the Gentiles, of whom ye shall inherit, served their gods, upon the high mountains and upon the hills and under every green tree;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye shall overthrow their altars and break their images and burn their groves with fire; and ye shall hew down the statues of their gods and destroy the names of them out of that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not do so unto the LORD your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye shall seek the place which the LORD your God shall choose out of all your tribes to put his name there for his habitation, and thou shalt go there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there ye shall bring your burnt offerings and your sacrifices and your tithes and the offerings of your hand and your vows and your freewill offerings and the firstborn of your cows and of your sheep;
speaker: Narrator

text: and there ye shall eat before the LORD your God, and ye and your households shall rejoice in every work of your hands in which the LORD thy God has blessed thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, each man doing what seems right in his own eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye are not as yet come to the rest and to the inheritance, which the LORD your God gives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when ye pass the Jordan and dwell in the land which the LORD your God gives you to inherit and when he gives you rest from all your enemies round about, so that ye dwell in safety,
speaker: Narrator

text: then there shall be a place which the LORD your God shall choose to cause his name to dwell there; there shall ye bring all that I command you: your burnt offerings and your sacrifices, your tithes and the offerings of your hand and all your choice of vows which ye vow unto the LORD;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye shall rejoice before the LORD your God, ye and your sons and your daughters and your menslaves and your maidslaves and the Levite that is within your gates because he has no part nor inheritance with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thyself that thou not offer thy burnt offerings in any place that thou seest
speaker: Narrator

text: but in the place which the LORD shall choose in one of thy tribes; there thou shalt offer thy burnt offerings, and there thou shalt do all that I command thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, thou may kill and eat flesh in all thy gates, according to the desire of thy soul, according to the blessing of the LORD thy God which he has given thee; the unclean and the clean may eat thereof, as of the roebuck and as of the hart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only ye shall not eat the blood; ye shall pour it upon the earth as water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou may not eat within thy gates the tithe of thy grain or of thy wine or of thy oil or the firstborn of thy cows or of thy sheep nor any of thy vows which thou hast promised nor thy freewill offerings or the heave offerings of thy hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou must eat them before the LORD thy God in the place which the LORD thy God shall have chosen, thou and thy son and thy daughter and thy manslave and thy maidslave and the Levite that is within thy gates; and thou shalt rejoice before the LORD thy God in all the work of thy hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thyself that thou not forsake the Levite in all thy days upon thy land.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the LORD thy God shall enlarge thy border, as he has promised thee, and thou shalt say, I will eat flesh, because thy soul desires to eat flesh, according to all the desire of thy soul thou shalt eat flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the place which the LORD thy God shall have chosen to put his name there is far from thee, then thou shalt kill of thy cows and of thy sheep, which the LORD has given thee, as I have commanded thee, and thou shalt eat in thy gates according to all thy soul desires.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even as the roebuck and the hart is eaten, so thou shalt eat them; the unclean and the clean shall eat of them alike.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only be sure not to eat the blood; for the blood is the soul (or the life), and thou art not to eat the soul with its flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not eat it; thou shalt pour it upon the earth as water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not eat it that it may go well with thee and with thy children after thee, when thou shalt do that which is right in the sight of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the things which thou hast consecrated and thy vows, thou shalt take and go unto the place which the LORD shall have chosen,
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt offer thy burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, upon the altar of the LORD thy God, and the blood of thy sacrifices shall be poured out upon the altar of the LORD thy God, and thou shalt eat the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep and hear all these words which I command thee that it may go well with thee and with thy children after thee for ever, when thou doest that which is good and right in the sight of the LORD thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the LORD thy God shall have cut off the Gentiles from before thee, in the place where thou goest to inherit of them, and thou dost inherit of them and dost dwell in their land,
speaker: Narrator

text: keep thyself from being snared by following them, after they are destroyed from before thee; enquire not after their gods, saying, After the manner that these Gentiles served their gods, even so will I do likewise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not do so unto the LORD thy God; for every abomination unto the LORD, which he hates, they have done unto their gods; for they have even burnt their sons and their daughters in the fire to their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thyself, and do all that I command you; thou shalt not add to it nor diminish from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When there arises among you a prophet, or a dreamer of dreams, and gives thee a sign or a wonder,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sign or the wonder comes to pass, of which he spoke unto thee, saying, Let us go after other gods, which thou hast not known, and let us serve them,
speaker: Narrator

text: thou shalt not hearken unto the words of that prophet or that dreamer of dreams; for the LORD your God proves you, to know whether ye love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall walk after the LORD your God and fear him and keep his commandments and hear his voice, and ye shall serve him and cleave unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, shall be put to death because he has spoken rebellion against the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and ransomed you out of the house of slavery, to thrust thee out of the way which the LORD thy God commanded thee to walk in. So shalt thou put the evil away from the midst of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thy brother, the son of thy mother, or thy son or thy daughter or the wife of thy bosom or thy friend who is as thine own soul should entice thee secretly, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which thou nor thy fathers have known,
speaker: Narrator

text: namely, of the gods of the peoples who are round about you, near unto thee or far off from thee, from the one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: thou shalt not consent with him nor hearken unto him; neither shall thine eye pity him; neither shalt thou have compassion; neither shalt thou conceal him,
speaker: Narrator

text: but thou must kill him; thy hand shall be first upon him to put him to death and afterwards the hand of all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou must stone him with stones, and he shall die because he has sought to thrust thee away from the LORD thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt from the house of slavery;
speaker: Narrator

text: so that all Israel shall hear and fear and shall do no more any such wickedness as this is among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou shalt hear in one of thy cities, which the LORD thy God has given thee to dwell there, that it is said,
speaker: Narrator

text: certain men, the sons of Belial, are gone out from among you and have incited the inhabitants of their city, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which ye have not known,
speaker: Narrator

text: then shalt thou enquire and search and ask diligently; and, behold, if it is the truth and the thing certain that such abomination is wrought among you,
speaker: Narrator

text: thou shalt surely smite the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly with all that is therein and the beasts thereof, with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt gather all the spoil of it into the midst of its plaza and shalt burn the city with fire and all the spoil thereof, all of it, unto the LORD thy God; and it shall be a heap for ever; it shall never be built again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And none of the anathema shall cleave to thine hand that the LORD may turn from the fierceness of his anger and show thee mercy and have compassion upon thee and multiply thee, as he has sworn unto thy fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: when thou shalt hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, keeping all his commandments which I command thee this day, to do that which is right in the eyes of the LORD thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye are the sons of the LORD your God: ye shall not cut yourselves nor make any baldness over your eyes for the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art a holy people unto the LORD thy God, and the LORD has chosen thee to be a unique people unto himself from among all the peoples that are upon the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not eat any abominable thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the animals which ye shall eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat,
speaker: Narrator

text: the hart and the roebuck and the buffalo and the wild goat and the unicorn (rhinoceros) and the wild ox and the mountain goat,
speaker: Narrator

text: and every animal that parts the hoof and cleaves the cleft into two claws and chews the cud among the beasts that ye shall eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless these ye shall not eat of those that chew the cud or of those that divide the cloven hoof: the camel and the hare and the coney, for they chew the cud, but do not divide the hoof; therefore they are unclean unto you;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the swine, because it divides the hoof, yet does not chew the cud, it is unclean unto you. Ye shall not eat of their flesh nor touch their dead carcase.
speaker: Narrator

text: These ye shall eat of all that are in the waters: all that have fins and scales shall ye eat,
speaker: Narrator

text: but whatever does not have fins and scales ye may not eat; it is unclean unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of all clean birds ye shall eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these are they of which ye shall not eat: the eagle and the ossifrage and the ospray
speaker: Narrator

text: and the glede and the kite and the vulture after his kind
speaker: Narrator

text: and every raven after his kind
speaker: Narrator

text: and the owl and the night hawk and the cuckow and the hawk after his kind
speaker: Narrator

text: the little owl and the great owl and the swan
speaker: Narrator

text: and the pelican and the gier eagle and the cormorant
speaker: Narrator

text: and the stork and the heron after her kind and the lapwing and the bat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And every serpent that flies shall be unclean unto you; they shall not be eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: But of all clean fowls ye may eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not eat of any thing that died of itself; thou shalt give it unto the stranger that is in thy gates that he may eat it, or thou may sell it unto an alien; for thou art a holy people unto the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not cook a kid in his mother’s milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt without fail tithe all the increase of thy seed that thy field brings forth each year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt eat before the LORD thy God in the place which he shall choose for his name to dwell, the tithe of thy grain, of thy wine, and of thine oil, and the firstborn of thy cows and of thy sheep, that thou may learn to fear the LORD thy God always.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the way is too long for thee, so that thou art not able to carry it, or if the place is too far from thee, which the LORD thy God shall choose to set his name there, when the LORD thy God has blessed thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: then shalt thou sell it for money and bind up the money in thy hand and shalt go unto the place which the LORD thy God shall choose;
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt give that money for whatever thy soul desires, for cows or for sheep or for wine or for strong drink or for whatever thy soul desires; and thou shalt eat there before the LORD thy God, and thou shalt rejoice, thou and thine household.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt not forsake the Levite that dwells within thy gates, for he has no part nor inheritance with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the end of three years thou shalt bring forth all the tithe of thine increase the same year and shalt lay it up within thy gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Levite, who has no part nor inheritance with thee, and the stranger and the fatherless and the widow who are within thy gates, shall come and shall eat and be satisfied, that the LORD thy God may bless thee in all the work of thy hands which thou doest.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the end of every seven years thou shalt make a release.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the manner of the release: everyone who has lent anything to his neighbour, causing him to be in debt, shall release it; he shall not exact it any more of his neighbour or of his brother, because the release of the LORD is proclaimed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the foreigner thou shalt demand that it be repaid; but that which thy brother has of thine thy hand shall release,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that thus there shall be no poor among you, for the LORD shall greatly bless thee in the land which the LORD thy God gives thee for an inheritance to possess it;
speaker: Narrator

text: only if thou carefully hearken unto the voice of the LORD thy God, to keep and to do all these commandments which I command thee this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when the LORD thy God has blessed thee, as he promised thee, thou shalt lend unto many Gentiles, but thou shalt not borrow; and thou shalt rule over many Gentiles, but they shall not rule over thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there should be among you a poor man of one of thy brethren within any of thy towns in thy land which the LORD thy God gives thee, thou shalt not harden thine heart nor shut thine hand from thy poor brother,
speaker: Narrator

text: but thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him and shalt surely lend him sufficient for his need, in that which he lacks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thyself that there not be a thought of Belial in thy heart, saying, The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand; and thine eye be evil against thy poor brother to give him nothing; for he shall cry unto the LORD against thee, and it shall be a sin unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt surely give unto him, and thine heart shall not be grieved when thou givest unto him because for this thing the LORD thy God shall bless thee in all thy works and in all that thou puttest thine hand to.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the poor shall never cease out of the land; therefore, I command thee, saying, Thou shalt open thine hand wide unto thy brother, to thy poor and to thy needy, in thy land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if thy brother, a Hebrew man, or a Hebrew woman, is sold unto thee and serves thee six years, then in the seventh year thou shalt send him forth from thee free.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when thou sendest him out free from thee, thou shalt not send him away empty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt furnish him liberally out of thy flock and out of thy threshing floor and out of thy winepress; of that with which the LORD thy God has blessed thee thou shalt give unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt remember that thou wast a slave in the land of Egypt, and the LORD thy God ransomed thee; therefore, I command thee this thing to day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be, if he says unto thee, I will not go away from thee because he loves thee and thy house because he is well with thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: then thou shalt take an aul and thrust it through his ear unto the door, and he shall be thy slave for ever. And also unto thy maidservant thou shalt do likewise.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall not seem hard unto thee when thou sendest him away free from thee, for he has served thee for half the cost of a hired servant for six years; and the LORD thy God shall bless thee in all that thou doest.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the firstborn males that come of thy herd and of thy flock thou shalt sanctify unto the LORD thy God; thou shalt do no work with the firstborn of thy bullock nor shear the firstborn of thy sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt eat it before the LORD thy God each year in the place which the LORD shall choose, thou and thy household.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if there is any blemish in it, if it is lame or blind or has any ill blemish, thou shalt not sacrifice it unto the LORD thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt eat it within thy gates; the unclean and the clean person shall eat it alike, as the roebuck and as the hart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only thou shalt not eat the blood thereof; thou shalt pour it upon the ground as water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep the month of the new fruit, {Heb. of Abib} and thou shalt do the passover unto the LORD thy God; for in the month of the new fruit the LORD thy God brought thee forth out of Egypt by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt, therefore, sacrifice the passover unto the LORD thy God, of the sheep and the cows, in the place which the LORD shall choose to cause his name to dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt eat no leavened bread with it; seven days shalt thou eat unleavened bread therewith, even the bread of affliction; for thou didst come forth out of the land of Egypt in haste; that thou may remember the day when thou didst come forth out of the land of Egypt all the days of thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be no leavened bread seen in thee within all thy borders for seven days; neither shall any of the flesh which thou didst sacrifice the evening of the first day remain all night until the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou may not sacrifice the passover within any of thy gates (or within any of thy towns) which the LORD thy God gives thee
speaker: Narrator

text: but at the place which the LORD thy God shall choose to cause his name to dwell in; there thou shalt sacrifice the passover in the evening, at the going down of the sun, at the appointed time when thou came forth out of Egypt.
