text: For the LORD shall judge his people and repent himself for his slaves when he sees that their power is gone, and there is none shut up or left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall say, Where are their gods, their strong one in whom they trusted,
speaker: Narrator

text: who ate the fat of their sacrifices and drank the wine of their drink offerings? Let them rise up and help you, and be your protection.
speaker: Narrator

text: See now that I, I am he, and there are no gods with me; I kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal; and there is not one that can deliver out of my hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I shall lift up my hand to the heavens and shall say, I live for ever,
speaker: Narrator

text: if I whet the resplendence of my sword and my hand takes hold on judgment, I will render vengeance to my enemies and will recompense those that hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make my arrows drunk with blood and my sword shall devour flesh, in the blood of the slain and of the captives of the heads, in revenge as an enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice, O ye Gentiles, with his people, for he will avenge the blood of his slaves and will render vengeance to his enemies and will reconcile his land, to his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses came and spoke all the words of this song in the ears of the people, he, and Hosea, the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses finished speaking all these words to all Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said unto them, Set your hearts unto all the words which I protest against you today, to command them unto your children and keep and fulfil all the words of this law.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is not a vain thing for you because it is your life; and through this thing ye shall prolong your days in the land, which ye shall pass the Jordan to inherit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses that same day, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Climb up into this mountain Abarim, unto Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, that is over against Jericho, and behold the land of Canaan, which I give as inheritance unto the sons of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and die in the mountain which thou shalt climb and be gathered unto thy peoples, as Aaron thy brother died in Mount Hor and was gathered unto his peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text: because ye trespassed against me among the sons of Israel at the waters of Meribah-Kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin, because ye did not sanctify me in the midst of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet thou shalt see the land before thee, but thou shalt not enter there to the land which I give the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the blessing, with which Moses the man of God blessed the sons of Israel before his death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, The LORD came from Sinai and rose up from Seir unto them; he shined forth from Mount Paran, and he came with ten thousands of holiness, at his right hand the law of fire for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, he loved the peoples; all his saints are in thy hand; they also united at thy feet; they received thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses commanded us law as inheritance unto the congregation of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was king in Jeshurun when the heads of the people, the tribes of Israel, were gathered together as one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Reuben live and not die, and let not his men be few.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this blessing is for Judah, and he said, Hear, LORD, the voice of Judah, and bring him unto his people; let his hands be sufficient for him, and be thou a help to him from his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Levi he said, Let thy Thummim and thy Urim be with thy holy one, whom thou didst prove at Massah and with whom thou didst strive at the waters of Meribah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who said unto his father and to his mother, I have not seen them; neither did he acknowledge his brethren nor know his own children; therefore, they shall keep thy word and guard thy covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall teach Jacob thy judgments and Israel thy law; they shall put incense before thy nostrils and a perfect sacrifice upon thine altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless, O LORD, his ministry, {Heb. men of valour} and take pleasure in the work of his hands; smite through the loins of those that rise up against him and of those that hate him that they may never rise again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Benjamin he said, The beloved of the LORD shall dwell in safety by him; and the LORD shall cover him all the day long, and he shall dwell between his shoulders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Joseph he said, Blessed of the LORD is his land, for the gifts of the heavens, for the dew, and for the deep that is stretched out beneath,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the gifts of the fruits of the sun and for the gifts of the influence of the moon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the summit of the ancient mountains and for the gifts of the everlasting hills,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the gifts of the earth and fullness thereof, and may the grace of him that dwelt in the bush come upon the head of Joseph and upon the top of the head of him that was separated from his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: His beauty is like the firstborn of his bullock, and his horns are like the horns of unicorns; with them he shall push the people together to the ends of the earth; these are the ten thousands of Ephraim, and these are the thousands of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Zebulun he said, Rejoice, Zebulun, in thy going out; and thou, Issachar, in thy tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall call the people unto the mountain; there they shall offer sacrifices of righteousness; therefore they shall suck the abundance of the seas and hidden treasures of the sand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Gad he said, Blessed is he that caused Gad to be enlarged; he shall dwell as a lion and shall tear the arm with the crown of the head.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he saw the best for himself because there the portion of the lawgiver was enclosed; and he came at the head of the people; he shall execute the righteousness of the LORD and his judgments with Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Dan he said, Dan is a lion’s whelp; he shall leap from Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Naphtali he said, Naphtali, filled with grace and full of the blessing of the LORD, shall inherit the west and the Negev.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Asher he said, Asher, more blessed than the sons, shall be acceptable unto his brethren and shall dip his foot in oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy locks shall be iron and brass; and as thy days, so shall thy strength be.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no other like unto the God of Jeshurun, who rides upon the heavens for thy help, in the clouds with his excellency.
speaker: Narrator

text: The habitation of God is eternal, and underneath the everlasting arms; he shall thrust out the enemy from before thee and shall say, Destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Israel, the fountain of Jacob, shall dwell in safety alone in a land of grain and wine; also his heavens shall drop down dew.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed art thou, O Israel, who is like unto thee, O people saved by the LORD, the shield of thy help and the sword of thy excellency? Thine enemies shall be found liars unto thee, and thou shalt tread upon their high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses went up from the plains of Moab unto the mountain of Nebo to the top of Pisgah, that is over against Jericho. And the LORD showed him all the land of Gilead, unto Dan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all Naphtali and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh and all the land of Judah, unto the utmost sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Negev and the plain of the valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees, unto Zoar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the LORD said unto him, This is the land which I swore unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, saying, I will give it unto thy seed. I have caused thee to see it with thine eyes, but thou shalt not go over there.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses, the slave of the LORD, died there in the land of Moab, according to the word of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he buried him in a valley in the land of Moab, over against Bethpeor, but no one knows of his sepulchre unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses was one hundred and twenty years old when he died; his eye was not dim, nor his natural force abated.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days; so the days of weeping and mourning for Moses were fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua, the son of Nun, was full of the Spirit of wisdom; for Moses had laid his hands upon him; and the sons of Israel hearkened unto him and did as the LORD commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there never arose a prophet since in Israel like Moses, who had known the LORD face to face,
speaker: Narrator

text: in all the signs and the wonders, which the LORD sent him to do in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh and to all his slaves and to all his land,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in all that mighty hand and in all the great terror which Moses showed in the sight of all Israel.
speaker: Narrator
